intro.speaker: Haar
intro.line: So... We're guessing that flare sent up from Geoffrey's troops means Ludveck plans to come for Your Majesty. He's probably marching his troops toward this fortress as we speak. Since it's come to this, I'd like to stick around and help. Let me know if you need me.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: ...I see. Thank you ever so much. Sir Haar... I have one more question. What about Lucia? Have you heard from her? Is she safe?

intro.speaker: Haar
intro.line: We found a man's body in the village safehouse. We believe he was her messenger. We also found this...

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: No! This is... This is Lucia's hair! But... How?

intro.speaker: Haar
intro.line: Well, we assume that Ludveck infiltrated her network of spies and captured her. This is his way of letting us know. It also means she's still alive, which means we still can save her. Queen Elincia, it's up to you to determine the best course of action.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Y-yes, I... I know... Royal guards! Arm yourselves, and prepare to meet the rebel forces in battle. I will be commanding you personally.

intro.speaker: Crimea
intro.line: Your Majesty! But...you are the queen! It's much too dangerous! Please, assign a subordinate to this duty!

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: I will not. It is my indecision that has allowed the rebellion to come this far. I refuse to run from this problem any longer.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Lucia... Lucia, I'm sorry. Somehow, I promise you... I will save you!

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Princess Leanne, Sir Nealuchi... This fortress will soon be under siege.

intro.speaker: Nealuchi
intro.line: Wh-whaaat?!

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Somehow the enemy has found out that I am hiding here. My two fine friends... You must escape.

intro.speaker: Leanne
intro.line: I...sing...and h-help...Queen Elincia!

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: No! Under no circumstances! I won't allow any such thing!

intro.speaker: Leanne
intro.line: I...like help...Q-Queen...Elincia.

intro.speaker: Nealuchi
intro.line: Now, now. When my lady makes up her mind, nothing in Tellius can sway her. And me? I'm sure you wouldn't mind having these old bones on the battlefield.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Sir Nealuchi... Honestly, I couldn't... Sigh...

intro.speaker: Nealuchi
intro.line: Wait until you see me... Even at my age, I'll be one step ahead of those freshly hatched whippersnappers.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: ...Very well. I must prepare as well. I had hoped this day would never come... Amiti, the treasured blade of House Crimea, will awake from its long slumber.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: ...The battle will begin soon. I want both of you to promise me that you will fall back if in danger. Understood?

intro.speaker: Nealuchi
intro.line: Fall back, Your Majesty? No one can hold a candle to the speed at which the raven tribe retreats.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Ha ha... That's a relief.

intro.speaker: Crimean Rebel
intro.line: Reporting, sir! Fort Alpea's gate is sealed, and they are readying their defenses.

intro.speaker: Ludveck
intro.line: I see... Lady Lucia must have arranged some way to warn the queen. But alas, even if they were to have all the energy and luck in the world, the Royal Knights wouldn't arrive for two days. In any case, there's no way we can lose, considering that we have a card which has yet to be put into the game.

intro.speaker: Crimea
intro.line: Y-Your Majesty, dire news! The rear gate is open, and the rebel army is storming in!

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: What?! how could this happen?!

intro.speaker: Lethe
intro.line: I think you'll understand once you question this man.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: You guard the inner garden, correct?

intro.speaker: Crimea
intro.line: You scum! You helped the rebel army, didn't you?!

intro.speaker: Servant
intro.line: Yes. Yes, I did. I did it because it was the best thing for the future of this country. Those Daein murderers killed my entire family, and now the queen bows down and wags her tail at them! It's a disgrace!

intro.speaker: Crimea
intro.line: Silence! You're the traitor here! Prepare to die.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Wait! Killing this man will do nothing to help our situation. We have to halt Ludveck and his men. They're already inside!

intro.speaker: Lethe
intro.line: I'm going out there, too.

intro.speaker: Mordecai
intro.line: Mordecai will fight for you, Queen Elincia.

intro.speaker: Brom
intro.line: You can count on me, Your Majesty.

intro.speaker: Nephenee
intro.line: Queen Elincia, Crimea needs you more than anything, and I reckon you could use my help.

intro.speaker: Heather
intro.line: My homeland, being ruled by a snobby stiff like Ludveck? Please. I don't think so!

intro.speaker: Crimea
intro.line: Your Majesty! We would give our lives for our queen! Allow us to fight!

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Thank you, everyone. I am indeed the queen of Crimea, and a queen does not hide. Our enemies are fellow citizens of Crimea. But we can no longer sit idle as they destroy the harmony of our nation.

intro.speaker: Ludveck
intro.line: Could our situation be any better? Just look at these fragile defenses... As fragile as the queen's reign! Ludveck: ...Oh? The queen's taken command? I expected her to abandon her people, turn tail, and run for the hills. How preciously naïve. We shall have to teach her that being overly optimistic can be fatal.

battle.speaker: Marcia
battle.line: Thanks to General Geoffrey, we spotted an ambush on the main road and snuck by on the old highway instead! The Royal Knights will be here soon. I flew ahead to tell you...and to serve you some traitor pie on my lance!

battle.speaker: Elincia
battle.line: ...Thank you. I'm impressed you made it back so quickly.

battle.speaker: Marcia
battle.line: My pleasure, Your Majesty! Now, which monkeys do you want filleted before the Royal Knights get here?

battle.speaker: Geoffrey
battle.line: Your Majesty! We'll countercharge their flank! The Royal Knights will succeed again! Indomitable knights of Crimea, this is the hour you have trained for! Hold the line, and run them down!

battle.speaker: Geoffrey
battle.line: Find Ludveck, duke of Felirae! Seize him immediately! He must not escape!

battle.speaker: Ludveck
battle.line: What a bother! They arrived far faster than I had expected. But I will prevail. I won't lose to that worthless queen.

battle-talk.speaker: Geoffrey
battle-talk.line: Elincia! I'm relieved you're safe. Leave the rest of the battle to us. Find someplace safe.

battle-talk.speaker: Elincia
battle-talk.line: No, this is my fight. This is my problem, and it will be resolved under my power!

battle-talk.speaker: Geoffrey
battle-talk.line: Very well. If that's your decision, Your Majesty.

boss.speaker: Ludveck
boss.line: Elincia! I yield to you! Please... You may imprison me. Your Majesty, be merciful! Spare our lives. We surrender our weapons.

end.speaker: Geoffrey
end.line: Queen Elincia! It's Sir Ike and the Greil Mercenaries! They came to our aid! Now we'll get Lucia back in one piece. We've nothing more to worry about. I'll deploy my knights at once!

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Sir Ike... If you hadn't come to help, I would have lost one of my dearest friends. Thank you... Thank you ever so much.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: We were happy to do it. And Bastian pays well for mercenary work.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Bastian?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Yes. The count of Fayre knew about Ludveck's plotting before he left for Daein. Bastian guessed that if he left the country, the rebels would feel confident enough to make their move. What else could you expect from Crimea's top tactician? Well...Crimea's most deceptive old dog, at any rate.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Yes, that's just like him...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Sorry that we had to stay hidden until the last minute. For a ruse like that to work, you have to deceive allies as well as enemies. I know you were acting in Crimea's best interests, but I'm sorry you had to let that happen to Lucia.

end.speaker: Lucia
end.line: No... It worked out fine in the end. Please put it out of your mind.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Lucia, Geoffrey... I value your lives more than even my own. But it's my duty to protect this country, even if that means losing you. I've learned a lot from all of this. I hope to keep them out of harm's way, and I'll never make the same mistakes again.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Good to hear. So what are you going to do about all the escaped rebel soldiers?

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: The rebel army will be eradicated. We cannot allow them to sow the seeds of discontent among the people of Crimea.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: That's the right choice. Would you consider contracting my mercenaries for the job?

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: ...No, Sir Ike. I'll leave that up to the Royal Knights. I'm certain this task will create anger among the people, and the Royal Knights may be resented for their role in it... But my duty as queen demands that it be done. The people will have to learn to accept that.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: I respect your devotion to duty. So, you don't need me then?

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: That's right. I'm going to move on, together with my vassals and the people of this country.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Sir Ike... Before you leave, there's something I'd like to talk to you about.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: What is it?

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: When you heard from Bastian... Did he say anything about Daein?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: No, nothing.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: He informed me of a number of things. Apparently Daein's reconstruction is playing out much like Crimea's... He spoke of a new king raising the banner of war, and a charismatic young hero carrying it into battle. He compared King Pelleas to me, and a "Silver-Haired Maiden" to you... It's almost unnatural. He suspected that someone might be scheming, trying to manipulate Daein. Bastian seemed quite suspicious of it all.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: So Bastian went to Daein to try and confirm his suspicions on that?

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Yes. There was also something about Daein's resurrection that we can't afford to overlook. ...The Black Knight.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: What?!

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: I'll never forget him... He was the one warrior who the late King Ashnard trusted. Encased in pitch-black armor, standing tall with a crimson cape... When the Liberation Army fought at the capital, he was there. He sided with the Silver-Haired Maiden.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: The Black Knight... The man who killed my father... But I defeated him three years ago. I'm sure of it. At the very least, he couldn't have escaped when Nados Castle came crashing down on him.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: The day after you fought, Bastian ordered some men to search the remains of Nados Castle. There was no trace of the Black Knight. No armor... No sword... No corpse.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: If the Black Knight that was seen in Daein was indeed the same Black Knight... He might prove to be a threat to Crimea.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Hmm. If he's still alive... I have no doubt I'll see him again. Elincia, this is very important information to me. Thank you.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Of course.

cutscene.speaker: Shinon
cutscene.line: Come on. Do it. It's a clean shot.

cutscene.speaker: Rolf
cutscene.line: I'm nervous. What if I hit her?

cutscene.speaker: Shinon
cutscene.line: It's too late for nerves, Rolf. If you're not up to it, just leave it to the master, eh?  Watch and learn. One clean motion, no hesitation.

cutscene.speaker: Mia
cutscene.line: Soren, always lost in your books! What have I said about watching your back?

cutscene.speaker: Crimean Rebel
cutscene.line: Form up! Surround them all! Don't let a single one escape!

cutscene.speaker: Mist
cutscene.line: Hold on, Lucia! Everything will be fine!

cutscene.speaker: Mist
cutscene.line: Can you hear me? Hold on!
